info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 08 at 5:55AM CST until January 09 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED MONDAY... .A frontal boundary will move across South Texas today. As a result, strong to very strong northwest winds and low relative humidity values are expected to develop, and result in Critical fire weather conditions. These conditions are expected to begin late this afternoon and persist through Tuesday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT FOR FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... * AFFECTED AREA...Bee. * TIMING...Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 67. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
